abstract: The Republican leader’s letter to the Treasury suggested the line his party would pursue when the Senate takes up the bill.
snippet: The Republican leader’s letter to the Treasury suggested the line his party would pursue when the Senate takes up the bill.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Democratic bill to overhaul the nation’s financial system would not end the “too big to fail” phenomenon or adequately protect taxpayers from having to bail out large companies, a leading Republican senator said on Thursday.

headline.main: Shelby Criticizes Reform Bill, Saying It Won’t End ‘Too Big to Fail’ Problem
headline.print_headline: Shelby Criticizes Reform Bill, Saying It Won’t End ‘Too Big to Fail’ Problem
